TextEquiv.Unicode: The Briol Dracle, and Country Intelligencer.
[VOL. II.]
SATURDAY, APRIL the 14th, 1744.

Advertiſements for this Paper (which is at preſent circulated by Po to all the comparable Towns North and South, from Liverpool to Plymouth throughout Wiliſhire, Dorſetſhire and all South‑Wales, and is extending itſelf farther every Week) are taken in by the Deputy Po‑Maers on all the Croſs Roads throughout England, or they may be ſent, (under Cover to Mr. Thomas Pyne, Pomaer in Briol) direly to the Author, who will take Care to inſert them, according to Order, at the lowe Prices. To prevent Miakes, all ADVERTISIRS are dered to give Direions in Writing how long they are to be continued.
N. B. Our Dates are according to the Old Stile or Engliſh Computation.]

Petersburgh, March 5. (A large populous well for- tiﬁed City, founded by Peter the Great in 1703, from whom it takes its Name, and carried on with that Rapidity, in Spite of almo invincible natural Obacles, that in one Year's Time it coned of more than 30000 Houſes, and now of above double that Number. It ands at the Bottom of the Finnick Gulph, is the Seat of the Court and publick Oﬀices, and at preſent even vies with Moſcow, the Metropolis, for Grandeur and Magniﬁcence.)
L

ORD Tyrawley, who lately arrived here, is exceedingly well received. He confers daily with the Miniers, and, 'tis thought, will ſpeedily carry his Point. The Engliſh Merchants who trade thro' this Country to Pera have Orders for twice the Quantity of Goods they ſent la Year.
POLAND.
Warſaw, March 17. (Capital of the Palatinate of Maovia, and Metropolis of the whole Kingdom, the Center of the Poliſh Dominions, and the uſual Seat of their Kings, Diets and Courts of Judi. at���)

The Report of Count Poniatowski's Death was only ſpread to give him. In Opportunity of retreating to a Place of Security 'till he ſhould obtain the King's Pardon. Count Tarlo's Relations, however, are preparing to revenge his Death, which, unleſs the King's Arrival prevents it, is likely to occaon new Troubles.
GERMANY.
Vienna, March 21. (The Metropolis of the Circle of Auria and all Germany; and, at preſent, the Seat of the Queen of Hungary.)
The Courier which Prince Lob��owitz diſpa�ched to give the Queen an Account of the Retreat of the Spa- niards into the Kingdom of Naples, and to require fur ther Inruions, is ſent back to Italy.
Ratisbon, March 21. (A free Imperial City of Ba- varia, and uſual Seat of the general Diets of the Em- pire.)

Yeerday a Convoy with Eight Field Pieces, and ſe- veral Waggons laden with Ammunition came near this Place, but the Captain demanding a Peage thro' this City, was refuſed and oblig'd to paſs thro' Stadt‑am- hoﬀ †.
Franckfort, March 29. (The Metropolis of the Cir- cle of Franconia, and, at preſent, the Seat of the Empe- ror, and general Diets of the Empire.)

The Count de Bavaria, his mo Chriian Majey's Ambaador extraordinary to the Emperor, arrived here Yeerday. Copies of the Plan of Operations for the approaching Campaign, are handed about here, by which it appears that a large Corps of Troops, under the Command of the Marſhal Belleiſle, are to paſs the Rhine, enter Wephalis, and penetrate into the Elec torate of Hanover
We are aured the Miniers of the Eccleaick Prin- ces, as well as thoſe of Saxony and Hanover, have re- ceived potive Orders to oppoſe the proje for aem bling a neutral Army in the Empire.
† Stadt‑am‑ho is a Suburb contiguous to Ratishon, at Southwark is to London.
ITALY.
Turin, March 12. (Metrepol��� the Principality of Piedmont and Seat of the D�� S�ver, now King of Sardinia.)

The French and Spaniſh Squ��rons are divided, the ﬁr are in Alicant. Road, and �e Re in three ſeveral Ports in Spain, fro whence we hear that they are in ſo ruinous a Condition that ſever of them will never be able to put to Sea again, and no� of them this Cam- paign.
Nice, March, 13. (The Metropolis of the County of Nice, part of Piedmont, anding on the Banks of the Mediterranean, at the Mouth of the River Vara.)

Yeerday we heard the ﬁring of Cannon at Antibes †, which made People conclude that Don Philip was ju arrived there. The French and Spaniards are aembred between Frejus and Cannes †, and fare m���ng the ne- ceary Diſpotions to attempt��e ��age of the Va�o� and to beege this Place. There are already arrived a� Antibes ſeveral Tranſports from the Coa of Provence.
FRANCE.
From the Camp at Cannes in Provence. March 18.

Every Thing is ready for throwing two Bridges over the River Varo, which the Army mu paſs in order to form a Line of Battle upon the Mountains; at the ſame Time two Bodies wi��a on the Side or Apremont, to diſlodge a thouſand Men which the King of Sardinia has poed there. It is believed another Corp� will paſs over by Sea to Monaco †, to attack Enemy, behind the ���, but no ��� are yet ��� for ��� porting them. Bedes there are 4 Engliſh Ships cruizing between Antibes and Villa Franca*, that Yeerday ﬁr�d ſeveral Cannon at us as we paed along, which has o bliged our General to raiſe 4 Batteries in order to force them to retire,
Paris, March 30. (The Metropolis of all France, and Seat of their Kings and Parliaments.)

Count Saxe is, at la, created a Marſhal of France, and is to be employed in Flanders. M. Rigaut, one of our mo celebrated Engravers, is aually engraving the Piures of the Pretender's two Sons, from the Originals done at Rome, by the able Mailers: Several Thouſands of ��� Prints are to be diribured in England, Scotland and Ireland.
LOW‑COUNTRIES.
Oend, March 28. (A ﬁne Sea Part Town in the Earldom of Flanders, belonging to the Queen of Hun- gary)

Twenty two Tranſports with 500 Horſe and a Quan- city of Recruits arrived here from England the 4th In. under the Convoy of two Mon of War, and this Day the Packet Boat brought over ſeveral Lords, and other Oﬀicers of � inion. The Crews belonging to the Ships that were ſeized at Dunkirk, are diſcharged and 50 of them are arrived at Nieuport ||, in order to im- bark for England.
Hague, April 3. (The ne Town in Holland, Seat of the Council of the United Provinces, and Aemblies of the States General.)
† Antibes is a Sea Port Town of Provence in France, about ten Miles South of Nice.

† Frejus and Cannes are both Sea Port Towns of Pro- vence, the ﬁr is ſo called from the old Latin Name Fo- r��� Julii, of which it is a corrupt Abbreviation. It was formerly a Roman Colony and one of their Magazines for Gaul, and there are ill ſome Remains of Roman An- tiquities. It ands about 30 Miles: S. W. of Nice, as Cannes does about �9.
* Monaco is about 8 Miles S. E of Nice, whoſe Head Land, together with that of Antibes, form a ſmall Bay, at the Bottom of which lies Nice and Villa Franca.
|| Nieuport lies N. E. of Dunkirk, about the Midway between that place and Oend. From this place an Eng- liſh Packet Beat goes Weekly to Dover.

Mr. Trevor Minier Plenipotentiary from the King of Great Britain, received an Expreſs from London, which he immediately diſpatched for Germany. ''I is ſaid that this Courier is going to Dreſden, Berlin, and Petersbargh, to demand of thoſe Courts the Contingents which they are obliged to furniſh to his Britannick Ma- jey in the preſent Conjunure, and this Day he pre- ſented the following Memorial to the States General.
High and Mighty Lords,

HEN, upon the ﬁr Notice of the Hoilities which France was meditating again the King my Maer, I had the Honour to demand of your High Mightinees a part of the Succour due to his Majey by the Treaties; your High Mightinees com- plied with that Requition with ſo much Cordiality and Readineſo, having been pleaſed to give, at the ſame Time, in your Reſolution of the 2d of la Month. Aurances of all the Aance which the common Intere and the Obligations of the Treaties might require, and which would be in your power, that it would be doing your High Mightinees an Injuice not to depend, in the pre- ſent Situation of Aﬀairs, upon receiving an Anſwer e- qually ready and favourable to the Demand which I have the Honour to make at preſent.

The King my Maer, who, by the open War, which France has ju declared again him, has a Right to promiſe ��� from the Equity and Wiſdom of your High Migh��nees, the entire Eﬀe of the Engagements which to cloſely unite the two Nations, and which con- ��� me to require your ��� pro��� the �� ther pare of ��� the �. �ealy of �� Year 1678, coning of 20 Men of War well mann� and provided, to the joined with all Expedition to the Fleet which his M�jey is aembling in the Channel.

At the ſame Time that the King expes this new proof of the good Faith and Friendſhip of your High Migh- tinees, his Majey commands me to expreſs to you his entire Satisfaion in, and an Acknowledgement of tha which he has ſo lately recei�ed, and to aure your High Mightionees of the exae Return on his part, in ſo criti- cal a Conjunure, where the Hearts and Hands of the two Nations ought to be united as there of one People.

It is, High and Mighty Lords, this real and eﬀeive Union, that, next to the Bleng of the Almighty, (which the Juneſs of his Majey's Arms gives the great- e Reaſon to hope for) is the ronge and ſecure Bar- rier that we can oppoſe again every Enemy to the proſperity, the Liberty, and Independency of our reſpec- tive Countries. Done at the Hague this 14th Day of April, 1744.
Signel,
Robert Trevor.
LONDON, APRIL 7.
His Pruan Majey has declared, that the Troops who have Orders to hold themſelves ready to march, are intended ��� the Service of his. Britannick Majey; but are not to ��� in the Empire.
They write from Paris, that in the mid of all the violent Meaſures taken there, many People of Penetration are of Opinion that a Peace is at Hand.

The Commioners of the Navy have order'd 500 Oxen and 500 Hogs for Dover, and the ſame Number of Oxen and Hogs for Portſmouth, to be kili'd im- mediately, for the more ſpeedy viualling ſuch Privateers as ſhall be tted out by the Government to cruize again the French.

La Wedneſday Night one of the Centinels that guarded the Magazine near Greenwich hearing ſome Body coming, gave the Watch Word three ſeveral Times, but no Body anſwer'd, and it being extreamely dark, could not ſee any Body, after which he ﬁred his Piece; where- upon ſome Body return'd the Fire, and ſhot the Centine� in the Leg, which alarm'd the Guard, who, with the
W
MONDAY's POST.
On Friday la arrived a Mail from Holland.
RUSSIA.
